London Olympics Closing Ceremony

The London Games ended with a bang, capping the 17-day extravaganza with an array of British cultural icons and a pyrotechnics display for the departing athletes. Getty Images
Two French athletes shared an emotional moment during the "Parade of Flags," a procession of Olympic athletes and a tradition that began at the 1956 Games. Getty Images
British singer George Michael performed in front of his home crowd as part of a pageant of English musicians slated to perform during the closing ceremony. Getty Images
Performers parading around in glowing garments could be seen far and near as they took part in the closing ceremony held at the Olympic stadium on Sunday. Getty Images
Closing ceremony performers cheered excitedly as fireworks burst overhead to illuminate the night's sky and to celebrate the end of the London Games. Getty Images
A phoenix made of lights glistened while rising in front of the Olympic rings inside the Olympic stadium during the closing ceremony of the 2012 London Olympic Games. Getty Images
British comedian and actor Russel Brand posed for a picture while flashes from the cameras added to the brilliant display of lights that was constant at the ceremony. AFP
Victoria Beckham of the British pop quintet Spice Girls performed during the closing ceremony. Other performers included The Who and members of Queen. AFP
As the closing ceremony came to an end, so too did the Olympic flame, which was extinguished in a gesture to symbolize the end of the 2012 Olympic Games. Getty Images
Eduardo Paes, the mayor of Rio de Janeiro, marched during the closing ceremony while holding the Olympic flag. Rio de Janeiro will host the 2016 Olympic Games. AFP
  • London puts final touches on successful Games
  • US wrestler wins gold  |  US runner 4th in marathon
  • IOC lauds anti-doping | Medals table | Sunday’s medals
